snippet: Decades of development and historic district restrictions make new construction rare, so investors typically buy hotels on or near the waterfront and renovate them.
abstract: Real estate investors seem to be flocking to Miami Beach, in hopes of capturing part of the market’s resurgent tourism industry by acquiring, or by expanding their investments in, limited supply of hotel properties.
lead_paragraph: Decades of development and historic district restrictions make new construction rare, so investors typically buy hotels on or near the waterfront and renovate them.

headline.seo: Hotel Investors Head to Miami Beach as Tourism Rebounds
headline.main: Tourism Up, Hotel Investors Flock to Miami Beach
headline.print_headline: Tourism Up, Hotel Investors Flock to Miami Beach
